answers.answer: ok this is my story.  I was 38 weeks went to the dr. I had gained 6lbs in 6 days.  The nurse took my blood pressure and was shocked with my weight.  Then left me in the room undressed from waste down..gotta love that forever.  Short staffed dr. delivering. So I called my husband by this time I am crying because I have gained so much weight in such little time.  The nurse practioner said "oh honey don't worry it is just water weight"  I was soo swollen.  They told me to watch my salt.  So I came home and read everything I could online about this and pre-eclampsia.  Freaked myself out.  I read that a low sodium diet is 400-1000mg of sodium a day.  So I decided to go to the grocery store and find things that were low sodium to eat.  I did this and you cannot eat much on 1000mg a day.  So I started this last week and with an exception to a bbq on sunday I have been eating this way since last Thursday evening.  So hungry I thought I would be sick everyday.  I went to dr. last night and all of that weight is now gone.  I still swell some but not like I was.  I told my husband forget it we are going to dinner.  I ate whatever I wanted.  It is mostly the heat that was making me swell.  It is 105 degrees here.  I would just watch it and try eating less sodium.  If you actually look at things it is incredible what is in some things.  Frosted mini wheats, water melon, fresh fruits and fresh veggies, a salad dressing low in sodium, which is hard to find. I used two cans of low sodium tomato sauce and some mrs. dash kind of stuff and some turkey burger and made spag. sauce.  It was good.  Try lowering sodium for a few days see if it makes a difference.  Good luck to ya.

oh ya by the way i did not have any high blood pressure.  I had gained the 6lbs.  they made me come back in two days to check b/p again.  Gone down 2 1/2lbs by then, and then back five days later down another 4 1/2 lbs.  So now i have only gained 18lbs thru this whole pregnancy.  It is great.  Just watch the b/p and try lowering sodium.  For me it made a world of difference. I also had my husband rub my feet and legs every night afterall he did this to me....ha ha.  Helps alot.

I freaked out at my last appt. I knew that I had gained weight, but i was expecting 4 lbs. or so. When she said 9 lb.s, i almost had a heart-attack! I thought I had only gained 5 before that and 9 lbs. was almost double. Turns out that i had only gained 3 lb.s before that but that means i TRIPLED my total weight gain in 4 weeks! Of course I rationalized it (i was wearing jeans & you should NEVER weigh in jeans and i had a lot of sodium the day before), but whether or not any of that made a difference i'll never know. I just had to focus on the fact that 12 lbs. at 24 wks. was not bad at all. And i think i'm hitting my big growth spurt (at least i hope!).
